name: Residence Inn White Plains

reviews.text: My wife and I found the service at the Residence Inn in White Plains to be excellent. The room was a really good size and very clean. They have a buffet breakfast, where you can make your own waffles, all included in the room rate, as well on on site, free parking. Really convenient located if you want to do day trips to Manhattan.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: I love this hotel. It's convenient for me when I'm doing business outside of NY. The staff is super friendly and the rooms are clean and roomy. You can't beat the fresh black and white cookies in the lobby everyday either. On site parking is a plus too and pretty reasonable for the price.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Great value if you need to stay in White Plains.
reviews.title: Great Value.

reviews.text: Walking distance to everything in downtown. Ample parking. Large rooms. Clean rooms. Friendly service.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff and well kept property.

reviews.text: At this price point, you can't find a better stay in White Plains.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved this hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed at Res. Inn White Plains on weekend of June 28 - July 1, 2013 (3 nights). We were a family of 5. The location is great (walk to everything), the rooms were very spacious (we got an executive suite but the regular suite would have been fine) and the service was amazing. All the staff (especially the front desk) were very nice and accommodating. I would have given the review a 5 star rating but there was no pool and the beds weren't the best. The beds were a bit firm for my liking. My kids would have enjoyed a pool but the extra space in the room sort of made up for the lack of pool. The warm buffet breakfast was good. The Res. Inn is not the Ritz (which is 2 blocks away). But if you want to pay double, have a much smaller room and no breakfast, then stay at the Ritz. Thank you to the front desk at the Res. Inn for this past weekend - sorry guys, I can't remember your names - Jason? and ? The next time I visit White Plains, I will come back to the Res. Inn.
reviews.title: Great Location, Lots of Space and Excellent Service

reviews.text: I have stayed in nearly all the Marriott properties in the area and this was my first and last time here.
reviews.title: Old and in need of updating.

reviews.text: It is old and dirty and needs to be updated ( see just 2 examples with the pics I uploaded ).
reviews.title: Space to spread out
Okay, better than the Crowne Plaza...
reviews.text: It was the most uncomfortable bed with cheap linens. The hallway was so hot as if the Air conditioner was not even working.

The only positive is the location right down town in White Plains. And for all the reviews saying it is such a great vaule and cheaper then the other hotels in the area , I need to say there is a reason why.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel staff anywhere.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for over 60 days while we were in temporary living after moving to this area from Minnesota. The staff was just great! They always said hello when they saw us walking by the front desk and even learned our names. Beverly always greeted us every morning when we came down for breakfast and asked us how we were doing, making sure everything was going well. Jason at the front desk was awesome! He even gave us a recommendation for a pediatrician since we are expecting our first child in a couple months.
reviews.title: Great place for temporary living of 60+ days!

reviews.text: The location is great. It's within walking distance to lots of restaurants, a mall, Starbucks, the post office, etc. It's also really close to a super nice mall and close to several parkways and 287.We used their same day dry-cleaning service several times. The parking is very convenient. We also had our dog with us the whole time and they were so great with her. When we would call for service when it was convenient for us (with the dog) they would come right up. They also provide dinner every Monday-Thursday night which is nice when you get tired of eating out every night. The room we got was on a corner and very spacious. The rooms also have all the dishes/utensils you need to live for a couple months. We didn't make food in the room very often, but it was nice to have the option. There's also a dishwasher if you do use the dishes.
reviews.title: good location, friendly staff

reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel to others. The staff is really the best. We weren't looking forward to staying in a hotel for this long, but it hasn't even felt that long. We definitely didn't have this sort of experience in the last extended stay hotel we stayed at during our previous move and we're very thankful all they did to make us feel comfortable.
reviews.title: Nicely Refurbished Commons, Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on business. Suite was very roomy with separate bedroom and living area. Comfey bed. Good work area, easy plugs for electronics, adjustable height desk chair. Wish the desk phone had a speaker.
reviews.title: Great alternative from staying in NYC

reviews.text: Nicely appointed rooms with some signs of aging, eg spots on sofa, minor damage on kitchen baseboard, but generally well kept and clean. Plenty of dishes,silverware, etc. Wish coffee cups were mug size instead of shot-glass size.
reviews.title: Super Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great one-night stay. The rooms are clean, quiet and large with separate bedroom and living, dining & kitchen areas. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is adequate, but they seemed to have difficulty keeping some things filled. The location is also great and within walking distance of many restaurants, theatre, etc. I would stay here again if I ever returned to White Plains.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Huge Rooms

reviews.text: I hadn't reserved this hotel but I was driving from Virginia to Boston with 2 small kids and got stuck in more traffic than usual. It was late, I was exhausted, so I called Marriott and asked if there was any way to cancel a night at the Marriott Boston I had booked, and find a hotel near White Plains. Within 5 minutes she'd found this Residence Inn for a good price, changed the other reservation, and I was on my way!
reviews.title: Modern, huge rooms and perfect customer service

reviews.text: The staff here checked me in quickly and the man at the front desk - Robert - personally showed me how to get to the parking garage and gave my kids a bedtime snack. It was nice to feel so cared for after a long day! The room was huge with a separate living room and bedroom, it was modern and beautiful! I plan to stop there again.
reviews.title: A superb hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were enormous. We had a bedroom and a large living room with a kitchenette and dining table. Easily fit 2 adults and 3 children.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, could use some upgrades

reviews.text: The staff are extremely helpful. Rarely have I met such nice staffers.
reviews.title: Spacious, Great Location, & Awesome Staff!

aka: Residence Inn White Plains Hotel White Plains
